argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | colperpex.p | |- P = ( Base ` G ) |
| 2 |  | colperpex.d | |- .- = ( dist ` G ) |
| 3 |  | colperpex.i | |- I = ( Itv ` G ) |
| 4 |  | colperpex.l | |- L = ( LineG ` G ) |
| 5 |  | colperpex.g | |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) |
| 6 |  | perpdrag.1 | |- ( ph -> A e. D ) |
| 7 |  | perpdrag.2 | |- ( ph -> B e. D ) |
| 8 |  | perpdrag.3 | |- ( ph -> C e. P ) |
| 9 |  | perpdrag.4 | |- ( ph -> D ( perpG ` G ) ( B L C ) ) |
| 10 |  | #P_eqidd | |- ( ( ph /\ A = B ) -> A = A ) |
| 11 |  | #P_simpr | |- ( ( ph /\ A = B ) -> A = B ) |
| 12 |  | #P_eqidd | |- ( ( ph /\ A = B ) -> C = C ) |
| 13 | 10, 11, 12 | #P_s3eqd | |- ( ( ph /\ A = B ) -> <" A A C "> = <" A B C "> ) |
| 14 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( pInvG ` G ) = ( pInvG ` G ) |
| 15 | 4, 5, 9 | #P_perpln1 | |- ( ph -> D e. ran L ) |
| 16 | 1, 4, 3, 5, 15, 6 | #P_tglnpt | |- ( ph -> A e. P ) |
| 17 | 1, 2, 3, 4, 14, 5, 8, 16, 8 | #P_ragtrivb | |- ( ph -> <" C A A "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) |
| 18 | 1, 2, 3, 4, 14, 5, 8, 16, 16, 17 | #P_ragcom | |- ( ph -> <" A A C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) |
| 19 | 18 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A = B ) -> <" A A C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) |
| 20 | 13, 19 | #P_eqeltrrd | |- ( ( ph /\ A = B ) -> <" A B C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) |
| 21 | 5 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> G e. TarskiG ) |
| 22 | 16 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> A e. P ) |
| 23 | 1, 4, 3, 5, 15, 7 | #P_tglnpt | |- ( ph -> B e. P ) |
| 24 | 23 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> B e. P ) |
| 25 | 7 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> B e. D ) |
| 26 |  | #P_simpr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> A =/= B ) |
| 27 | 15 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> D e. ran L ) |
| 28 | 6 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> A e. D ) |
| 29 | 1, 3, 4, 21, 22, 24, 26, 26, 27, 28, 25 | #P_tglinethru | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> D = ( A L B ) ) |
| 30 | 25, 29 | #P_eleqtrd | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> B e. ( A L B ) ) |
| 31 | 8 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> C e. P ) |
| 32 | 9 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> D ( perpG ` G ) ( B L C ) ) |
| 33 | 29, 32 | #P_eqbrtrrd | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> ( A L B ) ( perpG ` G ) ( B L C ) ) |
| 34 | 1, 2, 3, 4, 21, 22, 24, 30, 31, 33 | #P_perprag | |- ( ( ph /\ A =/= B ) -> <" A B C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) |
| 35 | 20, 34 | #P_pm2.61dane | |- ( ph -> <" A B C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) |
\
 Deduce a right angle from perpendicular lines.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Dec-2019.)  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
